{"step_by_step_thinking": "A radical neck dissection is a surgical procedure used to remove all of the lymph nodes on one side of the neck, along with some additional structures, to treat certain head and neck cancers. The sternocleidomastoid muscle, spinal accessory nerve, and internal jugular vein are typically removed during this procedure. However, the digastric muscle, which is a muscle located under the jaw, is not typically removed during a radical neck dissection.", "answer_choice": "B. Digastric muscle"}
